greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decrement by 1 all maximal digits in factorial base representation of n and then shift it one digit right.
comment: By "maximal digits" are here understood any digit k that occurs in position k, digit-positions numbered from the right and starting from 1. For example in A007623(677) = "53021", the digits "5" and "1" are maximal, because no larger digits will fit into those positions in a well-formed factorial base representation of a natural number.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: [in factorial  then shift one digit right]   [reinterpret
program: (define (A266193 n) (let loop ((n n) (z 0) (i 2) (f 0)) (cond ((zero? n) z) (else (let ((d (remainder n i))) (loop (quotient n i) (+ z (* f (- d (if (< d (- i 1)) 0 1)))) (+ 1 i) (if (zero? f) 1 (* f (- i 1)))))))))
from sympy import factorial as f
def a007623(n, p=2): return n if n
y="".join(str(i) if i + 1==int(x[i]) else x[i] for i in range(len(x)))[1:]
return 0 if n==0 else sum(int(y[i])*f(i + 1) for i in range(len(y)))
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 24 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 23 2015
